page.title: 03Riding for Disabled/Creca
page.content: The Lower Annandale Group of the Riding for the Disabled Association meet once a week at West Bretton, Creca. The children are from two primary schools and the Special Class at Annan Academy. There are about 11 children in all. They have learning difficulties and riding gives them enjoyment and self confidence. The Group is run by volunteer helpers and instructors according to the R.D.A. rules. Ponies belong to the Helpers and are brought every week. Safety is the first consideration, next enjoyment. The least competent children require two Helpers. One to lead the pony and one to steady the rider. Sometimes a child requires a Helper at either side. There is an annual gymkhana, Hallow'een party, and a challenge shield.
